publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-2785 Stuart McMillan: Inverclyde Council on Disability Celebrates 21st Birthday—That the Parliament congratulates Inverclyde Council on Disability (ICOD) on reaching its 21st birthday, which is to be celebrated in Greenock Town Hall on Wednesday 19 November 2008; notes that ICOD has gone from strength to strength over the 21 years and, from its town centre location at 10 Clyde Square, Greenock, is involved in providing information on many issues, provides consultations with various agencies, carries out access audits, provides disability awareness training, supplies a well-used Shopmobility service, which over 800 people have joined since it started in 2002 and assists in partnership with a learning service from Greenock library, and further notes that ICOD provides benefits advice and has carried out research in the past and networks with many voluntary organisations in and beyond Inverclyde. Supported by: Bill Kidd*, Alasdair Allan*, Bashir Ahmad*, Jackson Carlaw*, Sandra White*, Rob Gibson*, Kenneth Gibson*, Bill Wilson*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Bob Doris*
S3M-2785 Inverclyde Council on Disability Celebrates 21st Birthday (lodged on 29 October 2008) Jackie Baillie*, Alex Neil*, Keith Brown*, Christina McKelvie*
